alert.note: Alert for Central Arctic Plains; Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Central Brooks Range; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 18 at 3:52PM AKDT until October 21 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting to around 45 mph. * WHERE...The Dalton Highway and the Beaufort Sea Coast including the Prudhoe Bay area east and Barter Island. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Strong winds and blowing snow will decrease to visibility to half mile or less. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are expected to increase substantially from the west Friday morning along the northern arctic coast from around Prudhoe Bay east. Highest winds are expected Friday night from Camden Bay and includes Barter Island, where wind gusts could be as high as 55 mph. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and winds gusts of 35 mph is expected along Dalton Highway. Winds and snow will decrease Saturday night along the Dalton Highway and then decrease Sunday afternoon from west to east near Barter Island.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Central Brooks Range; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast
